Tues., July 10: Join our executive director as he explains the recent SCOTUS decision.
  

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

In a disappointing 5-4 ruling last week, the United States Supreme Court upheld President Trump's Muslim ban that blocks immigrants and temporary visitors from several Muslim-majority countries from entering the U.S. Join ACLU of West Virginia Executive Director, Joseph Cohen, next Tuesday, July 10 at the Islamic Center of Morgantown to learn more about the ruling, what it means for the Muslim community and those with ties to the countries impacted by the ban, and what you can do moving forward to help right this wrong.

Explaining the Muslim Ban
Tuesday, July 10, 6:30 - 7:30 p.m.
Islamic Center of Morgantown
434 Harding Ave
Morgantown, WV 26505
RSVP TODAY »

We, along with our partner organizations, have challenged every version of this ban. This is not the first time the Supreme Court has been wrong, or allowed official racism and xenophobia to continue rather than standing up to it. As with those rulings, history will judge this decision harshly.

We hope you can join us for this important conversation. RSVP today »

Sincerely,

ACLU of West Virginia
